column4: whats the command tologin as root?  su - or is it something diff?
well im using breezy and its not workin
ok Sudo works in breezy no su -
'su' works fine for any account with a password set
i know this but it wouldnt work in breezy, only worked as sudo
that's probably because root doesn't have a password by default
my root has a pass...  other than that. i dont know . hehe
I just tried "su". typed my root password and got a root shell
you sure you set a root password?
you can set a root password by doing "sudo passwd"
ooohhh.h..  good eye. It wasnt set.  :/
it means that the script which runs after installing the package exited with an exit status of 1, which is an error status.  non-error is 0.
